definition: to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
to promulgate/to send out/to issue/to grant or confer
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: The speaker declaimed against the government's new law.
sentences.chinese: 演说者攻击政府颁布的新法令。

sentences.english: Was he the first president to pass laws to stop slavery?
sentences.chinese: 他是第一个颁布法律废除奴隶制度的总统吗？

sentences.english: Towards this end, formal requirement documents have been compiled and advocated by FAW.
sentences.chinese: 一汽大众公司为此编写颁布了相关规范文件。

sentences.english: In 1980, the first amendment to the Marriage Law was issued.
sentences.chinese: 1980年，《婚姻法》进行了首次修订后颁布。

sentences.english: He passed laws against slavery and kept the United States united.
sentences.chinese: 他颁布法律反对奴隶制度，并使美国保持统一。

sentences.english: The case precipitates the French Parliament's ban on all transfusions involving humans.
sentences.chinese: 案件促使法国议会颁布所有涉及人类输血的禁令。

sentences.english: A law should be amended or repealed only by the same procedures that were used to enact it.
sentences.chinese: 法律只有经其颁布之同样程序方能被修正或废除。

sentences.english: What environment-related laws the government will enact next?
sentences.chinese: 政府不久将颁布哪些环境法规呢？
议会再颁布了那个法律。

sentences.english: Congress has enacted a new tax law.
sentences.chinese: 国会已颁布了一项新的税法。

sentences.english: Would it be right to enact even more restrictions on smoking in the interest of public health?
sentences.chinese: 为了公众健康利益，颁布更多的禁烟条款是正确的么？

sentences.english: Supergrid was announced November 13 after years of discussions and proposals.
sentences.chinese: 经过数年的讨论，超级电网计划于11月13日颁布。

sentences.english: Many countries have government-sanctioned recommendations that call for reduced dietary sodium.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家政府都颁布了关于减少食用钠盐的建议。

sentences.english: Kugel decreed that the day forever would be a day of absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 库高颁布法令，将当天定为永久的“荒诞日”。

sentences.english: Least one period, Netease has not yet promulgated a plan to open the new district.
sentences.chinese: 内测期间，网易尚未颁布开放新区得打算。

sentences.english: Harsh anti-Trade Union laws were brought in in the early 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 严厉的反工会法于80年代早期颁布。

definition: to put in place/to put into practice/to take effect
to repeal (a law)/to put an end to/abolition/annulled
to officially launch (a policy, program etc)/to appear on stage/to appear publicly/(of a bar girl) to leave with a client
to put into effect/to carry out
to issue (a memorandum etc) to lower levels/to distribute (e.g. disaster relief to victims)
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
